TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed HttpHandlerActionCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of elements. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The HttpHandlerActionCollection collection type allows access to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> elements of the configuration configuration section.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the HttpHandlerActionCollection collection to access the information contained by the `httpHandlers` section of a configuration file.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_89_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_89_1.vb)]
The following configuration excerpt shows how to specify values declaratively for the `httpHandlers` section.
``` <httpHandlers> <add path="Calculator.custom" type="Samples.AspNet.SystemWebConfiguration.Calculator, CalculatorHandler" verb="GET" validate="false" /> </httpHandlers> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The HttpHandlerActionCollection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlersSection.Handlers%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction httpHandlerAction) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds an object to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Before using this method you must create an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object and initialize it with the proper name and type. After that, you can add the object just created to the collection.
> [!NOTE] > ASP.NET searches for the handler assembly DLL in the application's private Bin directory first, and then it searches in the system assembly cache.
The collection must not already contain an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object with the same <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Verb%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Path%2A> properties.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object and add it to the collection.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/30785fad-32b5-4618-858b-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/30785fad-32b5-4618-858b-_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The object to add already exists in the collection or the collection is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `clear` directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file. All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.
## Examples The following code example shows how to clear the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> objects contained in the collection. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerActionCollection> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#12](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.configurati_41_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#12](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.configurati_41_1.vb)]

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance object GetElementKey(class System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement element) cil managed
.method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexOf(class System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction action) cil managed

Docs.param: The object for which to get the collection index.
Docs.summary: Gets the collection index of the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Before using this method, you must identify an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object with the proper name and type. You can then use this object to get its collection index.
## Examples The following code example shows how to obtain an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object collection index.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#9](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/73ebec17-721b-419d-aaae-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#9](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/73ebec17-721b-419d-aaae-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an item in this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction action) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes an object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to remove an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object from the collection.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/4e744ea3-31c4-4f1f-9fce-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/4e744ea3-31c4-4f1f-9fce-_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The passed object does not exist in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Remove (string verb, string path);
.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(string verb, string path) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Verb%2A> property value that belongs to the handler to remove.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Path%2A> property value that belongs to the handler to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes an object with the specified <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Verb%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction.Path%2A> properties from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to remove an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object from the collection.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/3ed7d08c-b330-4cad-a795-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#13](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/3ed7d08c-b330-4cad-a795-_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: There is no object with the specified key in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

Docs.param: The collection index of the object to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes an object at the specified index location from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method inserts a `remove` element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to remove an <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlerAction> object from the collection.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#11](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.configurati_73_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.HttpHandlers#11](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.configurati_73_1.vb)]
